dependencies.description: Autoconf -- system configuration part of autotools
dependencies.name: autoconf

dependencies.description: Automake -- make file builder part of autotools
dependencies.name: automake

dependencies.description:
The NVIDIA HPC SDK is a comprehensive suite of compilers, libraries and
tools essential to maximizing developer productivity and the performance
and portability of HPC applications. The NVIDIA HPC SDK C, C++, and
Fortran compilers support GPU acceleration of HPC modeling and
simulation applications with standard C++ and Fortran, OpenACC
directives, and CUDA. GPU-accelerated math libraries maximize
performance on common HPC algorithms, and optimized communications
libraries enable standards-based multi-GPU and scalable systems
programming. Performance profiling and debugging tools simplify porting
and optimization of HPC applications.
dependencies.name: c

dependencies.description:
The NVIDIA HPC SDK is a comprehensive suite of compilers, libraries and
tools essential to maximizing developer productivity and the performance
and portability of HPC applications. The NVIDIA HPC SDK C, C++, and
Fortran compilers support GPU acceleration of HPC modeling and
simulation applications with standard C++ and Fortran, OpenACC
directives, and CUDA. GPU-accelerated math libraries maximize
performance on common HPC algorithms, and optimized communications
libraries enable standards-based multi-GPU and scalable systems
programming. Performance profiling and debugging tools simplify porting
and optimization of HPC applications.
dependencies.name: cxx

dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.
dependencies.name: gmake

dependencies.description:
The GNU config.guess and config.sub scripts versioned by timestamp.
This package can be used as a build dependency for autotools packages
that ship a tarball with outdated config.guess and config.sub files.
dependencies.name: gnuconfig

dependencies.description:
This library provides useful functions commonly found on BSD systems,
and lacking on others like GNU systems, thus making it easier to port
projects with strong BSD origins, without needing to embed the same code
over and over again on each project.
dependencies.name: libbsd

dependencies.description:
Sodium is a modern, easy-to-use software library for encryption,
decryption, signatures, password hashing and more.
dependencies.name: libsodium

dependencies.description: libtool -- library building part of autotools.
dependencies.name: libtool

dependencies.description:
A portable and efficient C programming interface (API) to determine the
call-chain of a program.
dependencies.name: libunwind

dependencies.description:
pkgconf is a program which helps to configure compiler and linker flags
for development frameworks. It is similar to pkg-config from
freedesktop.org, providing additional functionality while also
maintaining compatibility.
dependencies.name: pkgconfig

dependent_to.description:
The Adaptable Input Output System version 2, developed in the Exascale
Computing Program
dependent_to.name: adios2

dependent_to.description:
Arkouda is a NumPy-like library for distributed data with a focus on
large-scale data science applications.
dependent_to.name: arkouda

dependent_to.description:
Chapel is a modern programming language that is parallel, productive,
portable, scalable and open-source. The Chapel package comes with many
options in the form of variants, most of which can be left unset to
allow Chapel's built-in scripts to determine the proper values based on
the environment.
dependent_to.name: chapel

dependent_to.description: C++ binding for 0MQ
dependent_to.name: cppzmq

dependent_to.description: A C interface to the ZMQ library
dependent_to.name: czmq

dependent_to.description: Fortran binding for the ZeroMQ communication library
dependent_to.name: f77-zmq

dependent_to.description:
C++ Message Queuing Library and Framework
(https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.1689985)
dependent_to.name: fairmq

dependent_to.description:
FFmpeg is a complete, cross-platform solution to record, convert and
stream audio and video.
dependent_to.name: ffmpeg

dependent_to.description: A next-generation resource manager (pre-alpha)
dependent_to.name: flux-core

dependent_to.description:
HELICS is a general-purpose, modular, highly-scalable co-simulation
framework that runs cross-platform (Linux, Windows, and Mac OS X) and
supports both event driven and time series simulation.
dependent_to.name: helics

dependent_to.description:
Hermes Shared Memory contains a variety of data structures and
synchronization primitives which are compatible with shared memory.
dependent_to.name: hermes-shm

dependent_to.description:
Libnrm, the application instrumentation library for the Node Resource
Manager(NRM).
dependent_to.name: libnrm

dependent_to.description:
MariaDB Server is one of the most popular database servers in the world.
MariaDB turns data into structured information in a wide array of
applications, ranging from banking to websites. It is an enhanced, drop-
in replacement for MySQL. MariaDB is used because it is fast, scalable
and robust, with a rich ecosystem of storage engines, plugins and many
other tools make it very versatile for a wide variety of use cases.
dependent_to.name: mariadb

dependent_to.description:
Melissa is a file-avoiding, adaptive, fault-tolerant and elastic
framework, to run large-scale sensitivity analysis on supercomputers.
dependent_to.name: melissa

dependent_to.description:
Melissa is a file-avoiding, adaptive, fault-tolerant and elastic
framework, to run large-scale sensitivity analysis or deep-surrogate
training on supercomputers. This package builds the API used when
instrumenting the clients.
dependent_to.name: melissa-api

dependent_to.description:
ps-lite is A light and efficient implementation of the parameter server
framework.
dependent_to.name: ps-lite

dependent_to.description: PyZMQ: Python bindings for zeromq.
dependent_to.name: py-pyzmq

dependent_to.description:
A cross-stack coordination layer to dynamically map runtime components
to hardware resources
dependent_to.name: quo-vadis

dependent_to.description:
Programming with Big Data -- Interface to 'ZeroMQ'. 'ZeroMQ' is a well-
known library for high-performance asynchronous messaging in scalable,
distributed applications. This package provides high level R wrapper
functions to easily utilize 'ZeroMQ'. We mainly focus on interactive
client/server programming frameworks. For convenience, a minimal
'ZeroMQ' library (4.1.0 rc1) is shipped with 'pbdZMQ', which can be used
if no system installation of 'ZeroMQ' is available. A few wrapper
functions compatible with 'rzmq' are also provided.
dependent_to.name: r-pbdzmq

dependent_to.description:
R Bindings for 'ZeroMQ'. Interface to the 'ZeroMQ' lightweight messaging
kernel (see <http://www.zeromq.org/> for more information).
dependent_to.name: r-rzmq

dependent_to.description: QuantStack C++ implementation of Jupyter kernel protocol
dependent_to.name: xeus

description: The ZMQ networking/concurrency library and core API
name: libzmq

variants.name: build_system

variants.name: drafts

variants.name: libbsd

variants.name: libsodium
